title: Castellar Granados
text:
My name is Castellar Granados. I am a Research Fellow at the Instituto de Iberoamérica of the University of Salamanca (Spain). At Salamanca, I am also a Ph.D. Candidate in Political Science. During fall 2024, I was a Visiting Fellow at LAPOP Lab (Vanderbilt University). I hold a B.A. in International Relations from the Comillas Pontifical University of Madrid, and an M.A. in Latin American Studies from the University of Salamanca.
My research focuses on political attitudes, inequality, public opinion, and the political inclusion of racialized groups.
My dissertation addresses how ethno-racial inequalities and different social mobility experiences influence political trust across Latin America.
You can reach me at cgranados@usal.es
